Rich

> A group of artists who all signed Kishu ju Sadanaga. There were at

messages.subject: Re: Pronunciation
messages.msgSnippet: Dear Rich Haynes refers to this artist as Sadanaga (H 07752.0)and notes as follows: D: ca 1650-1750 A group of artists who all signed Kishu ju Sadanaga.
messages.messageBody:
Dear Rich

Haynes refers to this artist as Sadanaga (H 07752.0)and notes as
follows:

'D: ca 1650-1750
A group of artists who all signed Kishu ju Sadanaga. There were at
least four or five generations. They seem to have come from the
early Edo period Hoan school. Some read this name as Teimei.
Furukawa catalogue pl27 #153.'

Regards, John.

--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, Richard Turner <ikkanshi@w...>
wrote:

signed

but is

Torigoye
> > Kazutaro .
> >
> > ? can be pronounced both as Sada and Tei and ? reads as both
Nobu and

> >

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Pronunciation
messages.msgSnippet: He is usually known as Kishu Teimei, at least outside of Japan. Alan ... From: Richard Turner  To:
messages.messageBody:
He is usually known as Kishu Teimei, at least outside of Japan.
Alan

----- Original Message -----
From: "Richard Turner" <ikkanshi@...>
To: <nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Saturday, July 02, 2005 8:46 AM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Pronunciation


Greetings all, I am looking into the mei of a new tsuba. It is signed
?????, which reads Kishû Jû Sadanobu according to Nihonto Koza but is
also read as Kishû Jû Teimei in the book Tsuba Kanshoki by Dr. Torigoye
Kazutaro .

? can be pronounced both as Sada and Tei and ? reads as both Nobu and
Mei, both are correct, so which one is right ?

Sadanobu/Teimei is a tsuba artist from the Kii provence.

Cheers

Rich Turner




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]




Yahoo! Groups Links

also read as Kishû Jû Teimei in the book Tsuba Kanshoki by Dr. Torigoye

? can be pronounced both as Sada and Tei and ? reads as both Nobu and
Mei, both are correct, so which one is right ?

Sadanobu/Teimei is a tsuba artist from the Kii provence.

Cheers

Rich Turner
